meanings.definition: To squat or crouch down low
meanings.sent1: The cat was hunkering in the bushes, waiting to pounce on its prey.
meanings.sent2: During the game of hide-and-seek, the children were hunkering behind the trees.
meanings.sent3: The spy was hunkering behind the wall, trying to stay out of sight.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a ninja hunkering in the shadows, ready to strike.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was hunkering down to get a closer look at the tiny flower.

meanings.sent1: The rabbit was hunkering in its burrow to escape the rain.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the family was hunkering in the basement for safety.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was hunkering in the hollow of the tree, avoiding the noisy birds.
meanings.sent4: The treasure hunters were hunkering in the cave, shielding themselves from the wind.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was hunkering under the rock ledge to seek refuge from the sun.

meanings.definition: To settle in comfortably for a long period of time
meanings.sent1: After a long day of hiking, they were hunkering by the campfire, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent2: The old man was hunkering in his favorite armchair, reading a book.
meanings.sent3: The cat was hunkering on the soft blanket, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent4: The students were hunkering in the library, studying for their exams.
meanings.sent5: The family was hunkering around the table, sharing stories and laughter.
